metadata.titleEn: HiWATER: Dataset of hydrometeorological observation network (No.2 runoff observation system of 312 bridge on the Heihe River, 2013)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：水文气象观测网数据集（2号点-312桥径流观测数据-2013）
metadata.description:
The No. 2 hydrological section is located at 312 Heihe River Bridge (100.411° E, 38.998° N, 1485 m) in the midstream of the Heihe River Basin, Zhangye city, Gansu Province. The dataset contains observations recorded by the No.2 hydrological section from 19 June, 2012, to 31 December, 2013. This section consists of two river sections, i.e., the east section, which is denoted as No. 1 and the west section, which is denoted as No. 2. The width of this section is 90 meters and consists of a gravel bed; the cross-sectional area is unstable because of human factors. The water level was measured using an SR50 ultrasonic range and the discharge was measured using cross-section reconnaissance by the StreamPro ADCP. The dataset includes the following parameters: water level (recorded every 30 minutes) and discharge. The missing and incorrect (outside the normal range) data were replaced with -6999.
For more information, please refer to Li et al. (2013) (for hydrometeorological observation network or sites information), He et al. (2016) (for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2012年6月19日至2013年12月31日的黑河中游径流加密观测中2号点的河流水位和流速观测数据。观测点位于甘肃省张掖市312国道黑河桥，河床为砂砾石，断面不稳定。观测点的经纬度是N38°59′51.71″，E100°24′38.76″，海拔1485米，河道宽度，70米、20米。水位观测采用SR50超声测距仪，采集频率30分钟。数据说明包括以下部分：
水位的观测频率30分钟，单位（cm）；数据涵盖时间段2012年6月19日-2013年12月31日；流量观测，单位（m3 s-1）；按照不同水位监测流量，获取水位流量曲线，依托水位过程观测获得径流量变化过程。2号点-312桥断面受到频繁人为扰动，水文断面面积不稳定导致水位流量曲线紊乱，流量数据有待进一步观测。缺值数据统一采用字符串-6999表示。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考He et al.(2016)。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 在异质表面上生态水文过程的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖了FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠地区已被前期研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，植被和土壤参数也被补充到数据集中。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a multiscale data collection method used to study eco-hydrological processes in a heterogeneous surface area?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于研究异质表面区域生态水文过程的多尺度数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: A multiscale data collection method used in the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) involves instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, including a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations, as well as hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
Example.AnswerCn: 在黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）中使用的一种多尺度数据收集方法涉及在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站的通量观测矩阵，以及使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological research?
Example.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，收集多尺度观测数据面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge faced in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological research is the poor availability of such observations, which hinders progress in understanding processes on a heterogeneous surface.
Example.AnswerCn: 在生态水文学研究中，收集多尺度观测数据面临的一个挑战是观测数据的可用性较差，这阻碍了对异质表面过程的理解。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a dataset that includes energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis-desert areas?

Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset that includes energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis-desert areas is the dataset from the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin, which has been established since 2012 and is available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个包含绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集的例子是自2012年起建立的黑河流域中下游的数据集，该数据集可从国家西藏高原数据中心获取。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the key features of the data collection methods used for capturing hydrometeorological observations in eco-hydrological studies?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 生态水文研究中用于捕捉水文气象观测的数据收集方法的关键特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: flux observation matrix, eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing technologies, LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, L-band microwave radiometer, ground measurements of vegetation dynamics, photosynthesis processes
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 通量观测矩阵，涡度相关塔，大孔径闪烁仪，自动气象站，高分辨率机载遥感技术，激光雷达，成像光谱仪，多角度热成像仪，L波段微波辐射计，植被动态地面测量，光合作用过程。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What attributes are essential for datasets in understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的关键数据集所需的基本属性是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: long-term energy fluxes, water vapor fluxes, carbon fluxes, methane fluxes, hydrometeorological data, radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature gradients, humidity gradients, wind speed, wind direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles, groundwater table data, vegetation parameters, soil parameters
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 长期能量通量、水汽通量、碳通量、甲烷通量、水文气象数据、辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度梯度、湿度梯度、风速、风向、气压、降水、土壤湿度剖面、地下水位数据、植被参数、土壤参数

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What features characterize the challenges in obtaining multiscale observations in heterogeneous eco-hydrological environments?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在异质生态水文环境中获取多尺度观测的挑战特征包括哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: poor availability of multiscale data, complexity of capturing eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces, need for hierarchically nested instrumentation, sparse networks, superstations, intensive observation periods, remote sensing missions
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 多尺度数据的可用性差、在异质表面上捕捉生态水文过程的复杂性、对分层嵌套仪器的需求、稀疏网络、超级站、密集观测期、遥感任务。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'multiscale observations' in the context of eco-hydrological processes?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文过程的背景下，“多尺度观测”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations refer to the collection of data at various spatial and temporal scales to understand complex eco-hydrological processes. This includes using hierarchically nested scales of instrumentation, such as flux observation matrices, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing. These instruments capture data across different landscapes and scales, such as oasis and desert systems, to address challenges in observing heterogeneous surfaces.
Definition.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测是指在不同空间和时间尺度上收集数据，以理解复杂的生态水文过程。这包括使用分层嵌套的仪器尺度，如通量观测矩阵、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站和超高分辨率航空遥感。这些仪器在不同的景观和尺度上捕获数据，例如绿洲和沙漠系统，以应对观察异质表面的挑战。

Definition.QuestionEn: How does the 'eddy covariance system' function in measuring environmental data?
Definition.QuestionCn: “涡度协方差系统”在测量环境数据方面是如何运作的？
Definition.AnswerEn: The eddy covariance system functions by measuring turbulent fluxes of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane between the land surface and the atmosphere. This technique involves capturing half-hourly data of these fluxes using specialized sensors that detect changes in air temperature, humidity, and wind speed. The data is used to understand interactions within the oasis-desert ecosystem, contributing to long-term environmental observations.
Definition.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统通过测量能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷在地表与大气之间的湍流通量来运作。这项技术涉及使用专门的传感器捕捉这些通量的半小时数据，这些传感器能够检测空气温度、湿度和风速的变化。这些数据用于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统内的相互作用，为长期环境观测提供支持。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the challenges in creating 'water level-flow curves' for river observations?
Definition.QuestionCn: 创建河流观测的“水位-流量曲线”面临的挑战有哪些？
Definition.AnswerEn: Creating water level-flow curves for river observations can be challenging due to the instability of hydrological cross-sections and frequent human disturbances. These factors cause fluctuations in the relationship between water levels and flow rates, making it difficult to obtain consistent and reliable flow data. Such challenges necessitate further observation and refinement of data collection methods to achieve accurate hydrological measurements.
Definition.AnswerCn: 创建河流观测的水位-流量曲线可能会面临挑战，因为水文横截面的不稳定性和频繁的人为干扰。这些因素导致水位与流量之间的关系波动，使得获得一致和可靠的流量数据变得困难。这些挑战需要进一步的观察和数据收集方法的改进，以实现准确的水文测量。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods used in the HiWATER experiment compare to those used for the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 in terms of capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: HiWATER实验中使用的数据收集方法与黑河生态水文遥感试验中使用的方法在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The HiWATER experiment utilized hierarchically nested instrumentation including eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing technology to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes. In contrast, the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 focused on river flow measurements using SR50 ultrasonic ranging devices with a fixed frequency of 30 minutes, emphasizing localized hydrometeorological observations.
Comparison.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验利用分层嵌套的仪器，包括涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和遥感技术，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。相比之下，黑河生态水文遥感试验则侧重于使用SR50超声波测距仪进行河流流量测量，固定频率为30分钟，强调局部水文气象观测。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What role does quality control play in the collection and processing of eco-hydrological datasets, and how is it implemented?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 质量控制在生态水文数据集的收集和处理过程中起什么作用，以及如何实施？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Quality control is essential in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of eco-hydrological datasets. It is implemented through careful sensor calibration, systematic data collection, rigorous data processing, and the generation of quality-controlled datasets. This process is vital for maintaining the integrity of the collected data and ensuring it is suitable for analysis and interpretation.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 质量控制在确保生态水文数据集的准确性和可靠性方面至关重要。它通过仔细的传感器校准、系统的数据收集、严格的数据处理以及生成质量控制的数据集来实施。这一过程对于维护所收集数据的完整性以及确保其适合分析和解释至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the instability in water level-flow curves during data collection in eco-hydrological studies?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究中，水位-流量曲线在数据收集过程中不稳定的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The instability in water level-flow curves can be caused by frequent human disturbances and the unstable cross-sectional area of the riverbed, which is often made of gravel and subjected to changes in the hydrological section.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 水位-流量曲线的不稳定性可能是由于频繁的人为干扰以及河床不稳定的横截面积造成的，河床通常由砾石构成，并受到水文截面的变化影响。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is multiscale observation considered a challenge in eco-hydrological research?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测被认为是生态水文研究中的一个挑战，原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Multiscale observation is a challenge in eco-hydrological research due to the poor availability of observations across different scales, which is necessary to understand complex interactions within heterogeneous surfaces, such as those found in oasis-desert systems.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测是生态水文研究中的一个挑战，因为在不同尺度上观测的可用性较差，而这对于理解异质表面（如绿洲-沙漠系统）内复杂的相互作用是必要的。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the need for long-term observations in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 哪些因素导致绿洲-沙漠生态系统需要长期观测？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are needed in oasis-desert ecosystems to quantitatively understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which are crucial for recognizing oasis-desert interactions and ensuring ecological stability and socioeconomic development in these regions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，需要长期观察以定量了解能量、水蒸气和碳的交换，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用以及确保这些地区的生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using a sparse network versus a dense network of observation stations on the accuracy and comprehensiveness of data collected in eco-hydrological studies?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用稀疏网络与密集网络的观测站在生态水文研究中对数据收集的准确性和全面性可能产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using a sparse network can limit the ability to capture detailed interactions and variations within the eco-hydrological processes, potentially leading to less accurate and comprehensive data. A dense network could provide more detailed and robust datasets to better understand the interactions between oasis and desert systems.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用稀疏网络可能会限制捕捉生态水文过程中的详细交互和变化的能力，从而导致数据的准确性和全面性降低。密集网络可以提供更详细和更强大的数据集，以更好地理解绿洲和沙漠系统之间的相互作用。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does frequent anthropogenic disturbance at hydrometric cross-sections impact the reliability of flow data in hydrological datasets?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 频繁的人为干扰在水文横断面上如何影响水文数据集中流量数据的可靠性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Frequent anthropogenic disturbances can lead to instability in the cross-section area, resulting in a disrupted stage-discharge relationship and potentially unreliable flow data. This necessitates further observations to improve data quality and reliability.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 频繁的人为干扰可能导致横截面积的不稳定，从而破坏水位-流量关系，可能导致流量数据不可靠。这需要进一步的观测以提高数据的质量和可靠性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of integrating multiscale and multidisciplinary data from diverse instruments on understanding oasis-desert interactions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 整合来自不同仪器的多尺度和多学科数据对理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating multiscale and multidisciplinary data from diverse instruments allows for a more comprehensive understanding of oasis-desert interactions by capturing a wide range of variables and processes. This approach can help address the challenges of understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, ultimately supporting ecological stability and sustainable development.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合来自不同仪器的多尺度和多学科数据，可以更全面地理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，捕捉到广泛的变量和过程。这种方法有助于解决理解能量、水蒸气和碳交换的挑战，最终支持生态稳定和可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the primary objectives of collecting multiscale and multidisciplinary data in eco-hydrological studies of oasis-desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统的生态水文研究中，收集多尺度和多学科数据的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objectives are to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces and to better understand oasis-desert interactions. This is achieved by obtaining multiscale and multidisciplinary data through hierarchically nested scales, which can help in capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes and supporting sustainable development goals in oasis-desert ecosystems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是解决在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的挑战，并更好地理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用。这通过获取分层嵌套尺度的多尺度和多学科数据来实现，这有助于捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程，并支持绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的可持续发展目标。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems in the context of sustainable development?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在可持续发展的背景下，维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Maintaining a balance between oasis and desert systems is crucial for achieving sustainable development because it helps ensure ecological security and supports socioeconomic development. Understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these ecosystems is essential for recognizing oasis-desert interactions, achieving carbon neutrality, and protecting the ecological stability of arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡对实现可持续发展至关重要，因为这有助于确保生态安全并支持社会经济发展。了解这些生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用、实现碳中和以及保护干旱地区的生态稳定性至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the significance of using advanced remote sensing technologies in collecting data for hydrological and ecological studies in arid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区的水文和生态研究中使用先进的遥感技术收集数据有什么意义？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Using advanced remote sensing technologies, such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers, is significant because it allows for hyper-resolution data collection that can capture detailed eco-hydrological processes. This technology supports multiscale observation, which is essential for addressing the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations and for enhancing the understanding of complex interactions in oasis-desert systems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用先进的遥感技术，如激光雷达（LiDAR）、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，具有重要意义，因为它可以进行超高分辨率的数据收集，捕捉详细的生态水文过程。这项技术支持多尺度观测，这对于解决多尺度观测稀缺的问题以及增强对绿洲-沙漠系统中复杂相互作用的理解至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are multiscale datasets obtained from eco-hydrological experiments processed and quality controlled to ensure reliability and accuracy?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 多尺度数据集是如何从生态水文实验中获得的，并且如何进行处理和质量控制，以确保可靠性和准确性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: All observational data are carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成的过程中都经过严格的质量控制。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the procedural steps for arranging instruments on hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in a desert-oasis system?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在分层嵌套尺度上安排仪器以捕捉沙漠绿洲系统中的多尺度生态水文过程的程序步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales. A sparse network was established to investigate the oasis-desert interaction, including one superstation within the oasis, four EC towers, and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations installed in surrounding landscapes like sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 仪器在绿洲-沙漠系统中以层次嵌套的尺度排列。建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，包括一个位于绿洲内的超级站、四个生态系统（EC）塔和四个安装在周围景观（如沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地）中的双层自动气象站。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are employed to handle data gaps and disturbances in hydrological observations due to unstable riverbed conditions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在由于不稳定的河床条件导致水文观测数据缺口和干扰时，采用了哪些方法论来处理这些问题？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The 2号点-312桥断面 experiences frequent human disturbances and unstable hydrological cross-section areas, leading to chaotic water level-flow curves. Missing data are uniformly represented by the string -6999, indicating the need for further observation to address data gaps.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 2号点-312桥断面经常受到人类干扰，水文横截面区域不稳定，导致水位-流量曲线混乱。缺失的数据统一用字符串-6999表示，表明需要进一步观察以解决数据缺口。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have facilitated the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步促进了在绿洲-沙漠系统中多尺度生态水文数据的收集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Technological advancements that have facilitated this include the use of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing technologies like LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 促进这一发展的技术进步包括使用涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站以及超高分辨率的空中遥感技术，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do intensive observation periods (IOPs) enable more comprehensive data collection in eco-hydrological research?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 强烈观察期（IOPs）如何在生态水文研究中促进更全面的数据收集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Intensive observation periods (IOPs) allow for focused data collection efforts using hierarchically nested instrumentation, which captures multiscale eco-hydrological processes through a network of sensors such as EC towers and automatic meteorological stations placed in diverse landscapes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 密集观测期（IOPs）允许通过分层嵌套的仪器进行集中数据收集，利用如生态系统碳（EC）塔和自动气象站等传感器网络，在多样化的景观中捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data processing techniques ensure the quality and reliability of hydrometeorological datasets collected in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据处理技术可以确保在干旱地区收集的水文气象数据集的质量和可靠性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Data processing techniques that ensure quality and reliability include sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and quality control procedures, as well as data archiving and sharing, which are essential for maintaining the integrity of hydrometeorological datasets.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 确保质量和可靠性的数据处理技术包括传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和质量控制程序，以及数据归档和共享，这些对于维护水文气象数据集的完整性至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in collecting multiscale observations in heterogeneous surfaces and how can they be addressed through innovative data collection methods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在收集异质表面的多尺度观测时可能会出现哪些挑战，以及如何通过创新的数据收集方法来应对这些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in the field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. Innovative data collection methods, like the instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales used in HiWATER, can help address these challenges by capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的限制。像HiWATER中使用的分层嵌套尺度的仪器等创新数据收集方法，可以通过捕捉多尺度生态水文过程来帮助解决这些挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the stability and reliability of water flow data be compromised in certain observational settings and how can this be mitigated?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在某些观测环境中，水流数据的稳定性和可靠性可能会受到影响，为什么会出现这种情况？如何可以缓解这种情况？
Expectation.AnswerEn: In observational settings like the 2号点-312桥, frequent human disturbances and unstable hydrological cross-section areas lead to chaotic water level-flow curves, necessitating further observation to improve data reliability.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在像2号点-312桥这样的观测环境中，频繁的人为干扰和不稳定的水文横截面区域导致水位-流量曲线混乱，因此需要进一步观察以提高数据的可靠性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What expectations exist for maintaining long-term observational datasets in arid regions and how might these expectations impact the understanding of oasis-desert interactions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区维护长期观测数据集的期望是什么，这些期望如何影响对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets are critical for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems, which is essential for recognizing oasis-desert interactions and supporting ecological security and sustainable development.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及支持生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of multiscale instrumentation in capturing eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估多尺度仪器在捕捉异质环境中的生态水文过程的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of multiscale instrumentation, as described in the metadata, is effective in capturing eco-hydrological processes because it involves a hierarchical arrangement of tools like eddy covariance towers and automatic meteorological stations. This setup allows for comprehensive data collection across different scales, which is crucial in understanding complex interactions in oasis-desert systems.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 多尺度仪器的使用，如元数据中所描述的，能够有效捕捉生态水文过程，因为它涉及到涡度协方差塔和自动气象站等工具的分层安排。这种设置允许在不同尺度上进行全面的数据收集，这对于理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的复杂相互作用至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are your thoughts on the challenges of maintaining data quality control for long-term hydrometeorological observations?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对长期水文气象观测数据质量控制的挑战有什么看法？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Maintaining data quality control for long-term observations presents significant challenges due to factors such as instrument calibration, data processing, and environmental changes. The field emphasizes that data quality is carefully managed through calibration and quality control processes, which are crucial for ensuring the reliability of datasets used in eco-hydrological research.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 维护长期观测的数据质量控制面临着显著的挑战，原因包括仪器校准、数据处理和环境变化。该领域强调，通过校准和质量控制过程，数据质量得到了仔细管理，这对于确保生态水文研究中使用的数据集的可靠性至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how observational data quality is maintained in eco-hydrological experiments across different scales.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在不同尺度的生态水文实验中，如何保持观测数据的质量。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Observational data quality is maintained through careful quality control measures, which include sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation as highlighted in the HiWATER experiment.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 观测数据质量通过仔细的质量控制措施得以维护，这些措施包括传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成，正如HiWATER实验中所强调的。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the methodologies used to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中多尺度生态水文过程的方法感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Instruments for the oasis-desert system are arranged in hierarchically nested scales, including a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing tools like LiDAR and imaging spectrometers.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按层次嵌套的尺度进行排列，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站以及超高分辨率的航空遥感工具，如激光雷达和成像光谱仪。
